anchoring.anchoring_output:
Enhanced reasoning process:
The manga series "Hana-Kimi" was serialized in Hakusensha's semi-monthly shōjo manga magazine, "Hana to Yume" in Japan. It consists of 23 tankōbon volumes and 144 chapters, showcasing the extensive storytelling and character development within the series. The English publication of "Hana-Kimi" by Viz Media made it widely available in retail stores, contributing to its popularity outside of Japan. The English title "Hana-Kimi" originated from a fan abbreviation of the original Japanese title, "Hanazakari no Kimitachi e." Hisaya Nakajo, the creator of "Hana-Kimi," is also known for her work on "Sugar Princess," showcasing her talent and style in the shōjo manga genre.

It ended with volume 23 in August 2004 in Japan and was published in English by Viz Media, with the final volume released in the United States in April 2008. The English release of "Hana-Kimi" was initially limited to Waldenbooks from February to May 2004 and then made available to other retail stores after May that year. The English title originated from a fan abbreviation of the original Japanese title, and Hisaya Nakajo is also the creator of "Sugar Princess".

Hisaya Nakajo
